data.title: Tasty Food, Fine Delivery, a Tad Expensive
data.text:
Recommended by our hotel, we tried something new with Pronto and ordered the small Tandoori chicken pizza with bruschetta for a light dinner. Delivery time was reasonable, about a half-hour. The pizza was hot and tasty (we’re not sure what zucchini has to do with Tandoori chicken, but it is a nice addition to the chicken, onions and Indian seasonings regardless) and the bruschetta and its olive-oil-and-tomato topping was also nice. 

However, we did notice the markup on our bill afterwards - $17 of menu items arrived at our door as a $20.50 bill, before tip. San Fran’s sales tax is high, but not that high. Overall, a reasonable pick in a pinch (and they are open late), but a bit expensive.

data.title: Greasy
data.text: We had the pizza and lasagna delivered to our hotel...the lasagna was swimming in grease.  The pizza was horrible.  The delivery was quick.

data.title: Neighborhood Gem
data.text: We were staying near the SFO Airport for an early morning flight and found this little gem for dinner. Pronto's is a little placed tucked into Grand Avenue.  They were very friendly and accommodating and served really great food.  As their name suggests, they have pizza and lasagna but their Italian specialties are worth a look. I had meat tortellini and my husband had cannelloni - both were exceptional and served with a house salad and garlic bread. Yummy all around.

data.title: Excellent food, terrific service!
data.text:
Had dinner here while on a business trip to San Francisco.

I had a small combo pizza with a house salad, by business partner had lasagna and a salad. 

He raved at the lasagna and the pizza was terrific--fresh ingredients, firm but not brittle crust.

When delivering a bottle of beer I had requested it was accidentally spilled.  My fault and not a lot was actually spilled.  The service person, who I believe was the owner, apologized and said "when you finish this one, I'll bring you a fresh on on the house!". 

This is a small family run business and it shows it by their attention to the customers.  They do deliver ( found a menu in our hotel room ) and seating is rather limited.

For great food and great service I'd come back here anytime I'm in town!

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Ordered a pizza and an eggplant parmigiana. Pizza crust and ingredients were excellent, but the eggplant (a specialty) left me cold. Sauce tasted very good, but a single piece of stringy eggplant. Pasta side was way over cooked limp penne, and the sauce was flavorless. Not worth the $30 or so plus tip.

data.title: Pronto's Delivered
data.text:
At the Holiday Inn Express to overnight before an early morning flight.  Needed to eat but unfamiliar with area.  Pronto was highly recommended by the Customer Service Rep behind the desk at the hotel.  Took her advice and was very pleased from the gentleman who took the phone order to promptness of the delivery (no delivery charge!).
I hand the Penne Chicken Romano and a side salad.  The portion sizes were large, ingredients fresh and still hot when delivered.  My meal would be perfect to share.

data.title: Thank you! Great late night pizza!!
data.text: We went to Pronto's this evening based on the fact we have a long layover in San Fran, and knew by reviews this place would be close to the airport and our hotel. We pre-purchased a Restaurant.com certificate, but showed up a little late just before closing time. Although they probably weren't supposed to allow the certificate to be used for take out, as their dining room had already closed, the nice guy who greeted us offered to let us use the certificate anyway. We got the Supreme Fantasia pizza, Banana Pizza (for dessert), Cheesy Garlic Bread, and a six-pack of sodas. It was great! Once back in our hotel room, we devoured almost all of it in one sitting. Thanks for a really freshly prepared late night option which worked out well for us on this trip! We agree with other reviewers that the pizza is excellent, and we had service which went above and beyond this evening. We gave a healthy tip because of the courtesy they offered and will be placing this on our list of food options for the times we are near the airport in San Fran. Thanks again!

data.title: great delivery
data.text: Very diverse menu, great delivery service... quality ingredients and preparation. I like their pasta rustica!

data.title: Delicious & Satisfying Meals w/Congenial Service
data.text:
We were lucky to find Pronto open; we hadn't had dinner, had a late & tough ck in at a local hotel where power was out for some time and were riding around aimlessly when we happened to find Pronto.  
We were welcomed by a very friendly, all male staff who couldn't assist us enough.  We had nice conversation with a few of the guys and we enjoyed our meal and time there.  The pizza crust was baked to a nice crispness and was quite appetizing.  We even enjoyed an order of buffalo wings and some nice cold soda over ice.  When their menu didn't milkshakes, our waiter offered to go to another shop and get one for us; how nice was that!

data.title: Good food and free delivery
data.text: We didn't want to brave the San Francisco traffic so we ordered from Pronto's and used their free delivery service.  They were on time with the delivery, included untensils and napkins.  The food was hot when we received it.  They have many choices on the menu so we ordered from there each of the two nights we were in the area.  All the food was very good.

data.title: Tasted good!
data.text:
After more than 24 hours of trip, everything taste great but sometimes is not the case...
We ordered Pronto for our meal in a near by hotel and the food was tasty and was a great meal.
We ordered a pizza and lasagna and both were great.

data.title: Good simple food
data.text:
After a few days of fast food this was a great find!  It is a small little place that has been around for decades in South San Francisco.  I had a sausage pizza and a small salad and found both tasty and reasonable in price.  I didn't stay to eat, taking it back to my room but would stay and eat in the place if with others.  

The menu looked like a traditional Italian place and the pizza was not a thick crust with good sausage, cheese for me the right amount of sauce.  The salad had fresh greens with olives, tomatoes and peppers and croutons.  I had the Italian dressing and it was just right, not to tart.

It is not a trendy spot but something more traditional and the people were really friendly and seem to be a family run place!

data.title: Great meal if you're staying near SFO
data.text: This is the place to get a nice Italian meal, the lasagna is great, the servers are always smiling. We eat here every year prior to flying out to Puerto Vallarta, they've become a tradition that we look forward to enjoying for years to come.

data.title: Great delivered meal
data.text: We stayed at an airport hotel before an early flight and asked the front desk for a delivery pizza recommendation. They were so right to tell us about Pronto. We should have split a small California combo instead of a medium, and one house salad would have been plenty. Delivery was fast; pizza was still hot. Discount for ordering on line.

data.title: Small Pizza Restaurant
data.text: A good pizza:). Small and cossy atmosphere. We were there as family. Had a nice dinner. It's open late night. I can advise.

data.title: Very good, nothing special
data.text: A small place and server friendly.  No beer on tap.  My pizza was good, but nothing special.  Prices were fine.  I don't know if I'd go back.  Just average.

data.title: Pizza and Minnestrone
data.text:
Previously known as Cecilia's, now under different ownership but same management.  

Historically, Cecilia's has been a staple in great Italian cookery in this neighborhood.  With the name change to "Pronto's" they continue in the tradition of good cooking and fast delivery. 

The pizza we ordered for delivery was very tasty and hot.  It was delivered very quickly by one of the young men that drive for them.  Eating the pizza the crust was perfectly done, crispy, chewy the cheese was melted and the ingredients just all came together nicely.  

It's a nice family that works the kitchen for this restaurant and they are excellent cooks.  I'm a big pizza and Italian guy and so far they haven't let me down. 

Pleased with the food, I went in for lunch one day to try their minestrone and Insalata Caprese (or tomato, basil, mozerella salad) served in a nice high quality balsamic and olive oil. All of it was really delicious. 

I will be ordering from them again, real soon.

data.title: Typical pizza and Italian
data.text: An okay joint, standard Italian American fare and pizza. My pizza was well prepared and tasty. Service was adequate.

data.title: Cold food - find somewhere else
data.text:
Ordered this to my hotel as it was the place the hotel recommended for late (10:30 pm) delivery. Ordered a salad, cheesy garlic bread, and buffalo chicken pizza. The order came within 45 min which was great! But when the delivery guy got to the hotel he called for me to come downstairs but he was clearly at the wrong hotel. Not a problem, directed him to the right place but once he pulled up he got out to get the food and realized HE FORGOT THE FOOD! Yes, the delivery guy forgot the food he was delivering...he ran and got it and was back within 10 min but the food was cold like it had been ready 30 minutes prior and the salad dressing had tipped over and poured into the bag so I had no dressing for the salad. 

Overall I wouldn't order from here again.

data.title: Just what you need
data.text: Very good food , we ordered a pizza and some sides and everything was delicious. The service was quick , the staff courteous. Will visit again
